alert.note: Alert for Central Somerset; Northern Franklin; Northern Oxford; Southern Franklin; Southern Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 17 at 11:27AM EST until February 17 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...MIXED PRECIPIATION EXPECTED TODAY... .Low pressure will move south of the area today with precipitation overspreading the region. Colder air will filter in from the north bringing the potential for a wintry mix with locations closer to the Canadian border changing to all snow. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation. Additional snow accumulations between 1 and 3 inches for a storm total of 2 to 6 inches with highest amounts near the Canadian Border. Sleet accumulations between one tenth and two tenths of an inch and ice accumulations around a tenth of an inch. * WHERE...Portions of south central, west central, and western Maine. Portions of northern New Hampshire. * WHEN...Until 7 PM EST this evening. * IMPACTS...A period of mixed precipitation is expected with air temperatures remaining below freezing. Expect slippery road conditions and avoid travel if possible. Even light snowfall amounts can accumulate on roads and cause dangerous driving conditions due to snow covered roads. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
